channel.title: Quick fix not hard just need a coder
channel.description: ok i need to make it so that when i read this clue scroll (id = 2678) that it opens a MainHelpMenu(); so here wat code look like [code]case 3033: if (ItemID == 2678) MainHelpMenu(); break;[/code] and heres the compiling errors [code]client.java:7339: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ItemID location: class client if(ItemID == 2678) ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code] help would be great ty in advance :P

item.title: Quick fix not hard just need a coder

item.title: Quick fix not hard just need a coder
item.dc:creator: @hyper1 hyper1
item.description:
@hyper1 wrote:

is there a section for cases that use objects and cases that deal with items ?? if so then i think ive got my problem
cuz i changed case 823 to openupbank(); and it working when u hit a dummy[br][size=1]Posted at: November 22, 2006, 05:33:34 PM[/size][hr]i got it w00t![br][size=1]Posted at: November 22, 2006, 05:39:56 PM[/size][hr]no thanks to u guys i figured it out
just to let u know its under switch(itemid) {
then u gotta put the case in there i had it under the switch(objectid) {
soz it my fault but i got it thanks for trying

yeah thought so its cheeze 80 mod

Ok then that means that is World 8 orignally. Those sources are really disorganised. A way I can help is by saying that you will have to find the proper code to do your case because “ItemID” does not exist apparently in Cheezscape version 80/Pimpscape.

item.source: Quick fix not hard just need a coder

item.title: Quick fix not hard just need a coder
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

It means it can not find the symbol “ItemID”. So no where in your client is “ItemID” other then that spot. It does not exist so therefore it can not be used. You will have to reconfigure/make a new integer called “ItemID” and set the right streams on it if you want that to work.

[quote=“Yakooza, post:2, topic:28016”]Try it without the case…

so its like this

if (ItemID == 2678) MainHelpMenu(); break;

make sure to put it at right place to[/quote]

Sorry dude, only help people if you know what the issue is and how to fix it…

…By removing the case it will only add more errors such as defining the if statement and will just waste more time.

Read full topic
